Server Functions

Server functions allow you to call server-side Rust code directly from your frontend components with full type safety and automatic serialization.

i

How It Works

Server functions are compiled to both the client and server. On the client, they become RPC calls. On the server, they execute as regular Rust functions with access to databases, file systems, and environment variables.

Basic Usage

server_functions.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2use philjs_server::*;
3use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
4 
5#[derive(Clone, Debug, Serialize, Deserialize)]
6pub struct Todo {
7    pub id: i32,
8    pub title: String,
9    pub completed: bool,
10}
11 
12// Define a server function
13#[server(GetTodos)]
14pub async fn get_todos() -> Result<Vec<Todo>, ServerFnError> {
15    // This code only runs on the server
16    let todos = db::get_all_todos().await?;
17    Ok(todos)
18}
19 
20// Use in a component
21#[component]
22fn TodoList() -> impl IntoView {
23    let todos = create_resource(|| (), |_| async move {
24        get_todos().await
25    });
26 
27    view! {
28        <Suspense fallback=move || view! { <p>"Loading..."</p> }>
29            {move || todos.get().map(|result| match result {
30                Ok(todos) => view! {
31                    <ul>
32                        <For
33                            each=move || todos.clone()
34                            key=|todo| todo.id
35                            children=|todo| view! {
36                                <li>{todo.title}</li>
37                            }
38                        />
39                    </ul>
40                }.into_view(),
41                Err(e) => view! { <p>"Error: " {e.to_string()}</p> }.into_view(),
42            })}
43        </Suspense>
44    }
45}

Function Parameters

1#[server(CreateTodo)]
2pub async fn create_todo(
3    title: String,
4    description: Option<String>,
5) -> Result<Todo, ServerFnError> {
6    let todo = db::create_todo(&title, description.as_deref()).await?;
7    Ok(todo)
8}
9 
10#[server(UpdateTodo)]
11pub async fn update_todo(
12    id: i32,
13    title: Option<String>,
14    completed: Option<bool>,
15) -> Result<Todo, ServerFnError> {
16    let todo = db::update_todo(id, title.as_deref(), completed).await?;
17    Ok(todo)
18}
19 
20#[server(DeleteTodo)]
21pub async fn delete_todo(id: i32) -> Result<(), ServerFnError> {
22    db::delete_todo(id).await?;
23    Ok(())
24}

Server Actions

Use create_server_action for mutations that you want to track:

1#[component]
2fn TodoForm() -> impl IntoView {
3    let (title, set_title) = create_signal(String::new());
4    let create_todo = create_server_action::<CreateTodo>();
5 
6    // Access action state
7    let pending = create_todo.pending();
8    let result = create_todo.value();
9 
10    view! {
11        <form on:submit=move |ev| {
12            ev.prevent_default();
13            create_todo.dispatch(CreateTodo {
14                title: title(),
15                description: None,
16            });
17            set_title(String::new());
18        }>
19            <input
20                type="text"
21                prop:value=title
22                on:input=move |ev| set_title(event_target_value(&ev))
23                disabled=pending
24            />
25            <button type="submit" disabled=pending>
26                {move || if pending() { "Creating..." } else { "Create" }}
27            </button>
28        </form>
29 
30        // Show result
31        {move || result().map(|r| match r {
32            Ok(todo) => view! {
33                <p class="success">"Created: " {todo.title}</p>
34            }.into_view(),
35            Err(e) => view! {
36                <p class="error">"Error: " {e.to_string()}</p>
37            }.into_view(),
38        })}
39    }
40}

Multi-Actions

For handling multiple concurrent submissions:

1#[component]
2fn BulkActions() -> impl IntoView {
3    let delete_todo = create_server_multi_action::<DeleteTodo>();
4 
5    // Get all submissions
6    let submissions = delete_todo.submissions();
7 
8    view! {
9        <For
10            each=move || todos()
11            key=|todo| todo.id
12            children=move |todo| {
13                let id = todo.id;
14                view! {
15                    <li>
16                        {todo.title}
17                        <button on:click=move |_| {
18                            delete_todo.dispatch(DeleteTodo { id });
19                        }>
20                            "Delete"
21                        </button>
22                    </li>
23                }
24            }
25        />
26 
27        // Show pending deletions
28        <For
29            each=move || submissions().into_iter().filter(|s| s.pending())
30            key=|s| s.input().id
31            children=|s| view! {
32                <p>"Deleting " {s.input().id} "..."</p>
33            }
34        />
35    }
36}

Error Handling

1use thiserror::Error;
2 
3#[derive(Error, Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
4pub enum TodoError {
5    #[error("Todo not found")]
6    NotFound,
7    #[error("Invalid title: {0}")]
8    InvalidTitle(String),
9    #[error("Database error: {0}")]
10    Database(String),
11}
12 
13impl From<TodoError> for ServerFnError {
14    fn from(err: TodoError) -> Self {
15        ServerFnError::ServerError(err.to_string())
16    }
17}
18 
19#[server(ValidateTodo)]
20pub async fn validate_todo(title: String) -> Result<(), ServerFnError> {
21    if title.is_empty() {
22        return Err(TodoError::InvalidTitle("Title cannot be empty".into()).into());
23    }
24    if title.len() > 100 {
25        return Err(TodoError::InvalidTitle("Title too long".into()).into());
26    }
27    Ok(())
28}

Accessing Server Context

1use axum::extract::Extension;
2use sqlx::PgPool;
3 
4#[server(GetUserTodos)]
5pub async fn get_user_todos() -> Result<Vec<Todo>, ServerFnError> {
6    // Access the database pool from server context
7    let pool = expect_context::<PgPool>();
8 
9    // Access the current user from auth context
10    let user = expect_context::<AuthUser>();
11 
12    let todos = sqlx::query_as!(
13        Todo,
14        "SELECT * FROM todos WHERE user_id = $1",
15        user.id
16    )
17    .fetch_all(&pool)
18    .await?;
19 
20    Ok(todos)
21}
22 
23// With custom extractors
24#[server(GetSecureTodos, input = Json, output = Json)]
25pub async fn get_secure_todos(
26    // Extract request info
27    headers: leptos_axum::extract::Headers,
28) -> Result<Vec<Todo>, ServerFnError> {
29    let auth_header = headers.get("Authorization")
30        .and_then(|h| h.to_str().ok())
31        .ok_or_else(|| ServerFnError::ServerError("Unauthorized".into()))?;
32 
33    // Validate token and get todos...
34    Ok(vec![])
35}

File Uploads

1use philjs_server::*;
2 
3#[server(UploadFile, input = MultipartFormData)]
4pub async fn upload_file(
5    file: MultipartData,
6) -> Result<String, ServerFnError> {
7    let mut data = file.into_inner();
8 
9    while let Some(mut chunk) = data.next_field().await? {
10        let name = chunk.name().unwrap_or("file").to_string();
11        let filename = chunk.file_name().unwrap_or("unknown").to_string();
12        let content_type = chunk.content_type().unwrap_or("application/octet-stream").to_string();
13 
14        let mut bytes = Vec::new();
15        while let Some(chunk) = chunk.chunk().await? {
16            bytes.extend_from_slice(&chunk);
17        }
18 
19        // Save file
20        let path = format!("uploads/{}", filename);
21        tokio::fs::write(&path, bytes).await?;
22 
23        return Ok(path);
24    }
25 
26    Err(ServerFnError::ServerError("No file provided".into()))
27}
28 
29// Component with file upload
30#[component]
31fn FileUpload() -> impl IntoView {
32    let upload = create_server_action::<UploadFile>();
33 
34    view! {
35        <form
36            method="POST"
37            enctype="multipart/form-data"
38            on:submit=move |ev| {
39                ev.prevent_default();
40                let form_data = FormData::new_with_form(
41                    &ev.target().unwrap().dyn_into::<HtmlFormElement>().unwrap()
42                ).unwrap();
43                upload.dispatch(UploadFile { file: form_data.into() });
44            }
45        >
46            <input type="file" name="file"/>
47            <button type="submit">"Upload"</button>
48        </form>
49    }
50}

Streaming Responses

1use futures::stream::Stream;
2 
3#[server(StreamingData, output = StreamingText)]
4pub async fn streaming_data() -> Result<TextStream, ServerFnError> {
5    let stream = async_stream::stream! {
6        for i in 0..10 {
7            tokio::time::sleep(Duration::from_millis(100)).await;
8            yield Ok(format!("Message {}
9", i));
10        }
11    };
12 
13    Ok(TextStream::new(stream))
14}
15 
16// Usage in component
17#[component]
18fn StreamingComponent() -> impl IntoView {
19    let (messages, set_messages) = create_signal(Vec::<String>::new());
20 
21    let start_stream = move |_| {
22        spawn_local(async move {
23            let mut stream = streaming_data().await.unwrap();
24            while let Some(msg) = stream.next().await {
25                if let Ok(text) = msg {
26                    set_messages.update(|msgs| msgs.push(text));
27                }
28            }
29        });
30    };
31 
32    view! {
33        <button on:click=start_stream>"Start Stream"</button>
34        <ul>
35            <For
36                each=move || messages()
37                key=|msg| msg.clone()
38                children=|msg| view! { <li>{msg}</li> }
39            />
40        </ul>
41    }
42}

Configuration

1// Custom endpoint
2#[server(
3    CustomEndpoint,
4    prefix = "/api/v2",
5    endpoint = "custom-action"
6)]
7pub async fn custom_endpoint() -> Result<(), ServerFnError> {
8    Ok(())
9}
10// This creates endpoint: POST /api/v2/custom-action
11 
12// With middleware
13#[server(AuthenticatedAction, middleware = [require_auth])]
14pub async fn authenticated_action() -> Result<(), ServerFnError> {
15    // Only accessible if authenticated
16    Ok(())
17}
